organizations.name: The World Bank
quotes: The World Bank was in charge of the agriculture, health, education, and, unfortunately, the private sector, and I think a little bit of governance, but mostly the governance was supposed to be with the UN.
Well, I think the World Bank is flexible in the sense of the project that I am doing with them [now], the public finance capacity building program.

organizations.name: UN
quotes: The UN was supposed to be government, judiciary, police, and the forces, I think, and ADB was infrastructure and power sector, telecommunications, etc.
Judiciary is still having problems and that is UNDP, the UN. Police is the UN again and what a mess. The armed forces, UN.

organizations.name: ADB
quotes: The UN was supposed to be government, judiciary, police, and the forces, I think, and ADB was infrastructure and power sector, telecommunications, etc.
Infrastructure was messy, electricity, a disaster! So, that reflects on ADB.

organizations.name: UNDP
quotes: Judiciary is still having problems and that is UNDP, the UN.
What actors did you work with in Timor Leste and which relationships were most successful?
Can give me any examples of a way in which the UN or the World Bank gave you flexibility to make policy decision in Timor Leste?
